messages: a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:01): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: fwiw, "attach" doesn't seem so bad to me.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:01): since it's used in other ways to describe interactions with processes
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:02): attaching to a thread somewhat implies a debugger actually monitoring the thread
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:02): which is not what this is
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:02): right, I see
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:02): but in the absence of a better term...
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:03): hmm, only other word I can think of is "tether", and that probably sucks more
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:03): heh
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:04): i used join, but joining a thread means waiting for it to complete, which isn't the same thing at all :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:04): so attach is a step in the right direction
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:04): but merely a small step
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:04): "connect"?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:05): could work
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:06): hook, tie, bind, pin, fasten, harness
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:06): and "hog tie"
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:07): connect is winning so far
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:08): "tether"
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (13:09): "tractor beam"
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (13:10): bear hug
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (13:10): assimilate
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (13:11): ponders <p><label>Text <input></p>
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:12): connect is best, since what you get back is a message port
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (13:12): connectToNamedWorker
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:13): it's still createNamedWorker() for consistency with createWorker()
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:13): the name 'connect' is the event name
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (13:14): How about assign?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:14): unless you think it should be connectToNamedWorker() and connectToWorker(), or connectToNamedWorker() and createWorker() ?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:15): why assign?
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (13:16): connect makes me think of connections and pipes and such
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:16): well the message ports did used to be called pipes
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (13:18): But that's for inter-worker communication, isn't it? Not for task-to-worker
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:22): i don't understand what you mean
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:22): message ports are how any two things communicate
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:22): whether they be in different workers, same worker, different frames, whatever
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (13:25): Just me being confused, then.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (13:27): bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2: Like normal.
bb76dfcc4f591df0120c3ef31743d8e2 (13:28): I should add it to my OKRs
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:31): something else we could use <browserbutton> for is the ability to move a page into the background completely
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (13:31): so e.g. you could hide google calendar and it could still be doing toast notifications of your events
